title: Why is Riot even experimenting with this stupid Archangel's Nerf?
body:
I'm serious.{{item:3003}}  for YEARS has been a 80 AP item with 3%  of Mana > AP.

Now that it's 50 AP, they want to raise its price 300+200 gold AND reduce it to 1% of Mana > AP?

That makes it a friggin MAX 80 AP item, even when charged up. Down from 190 > 150ish.

WTF?

How does that even make sense at all?

Here's some math to Illustrate why this is a big wow:

It was 2 patches ago, and It replaced {{item:3165}} 

{{item:3165}} +{{item:3003}}  USED TO BE:

400 + 1000 Mana (1400 Mana)
20% CDR (all on Morellonomicon)
170-190 AP on AA, 100 AP on Morellonomicon (270-290 AP total)

2700G > 3000G > 3100G > 3200G on {{item:3003}} 


Enemy Takedown = 20% Max Mana recovered (Lost to a rune mages can't normally use) on {{item:3165}} 
2400g > 2900 G > 3000g.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Total Gold:

5400G > 5900G > 6000g > 6200G (net 800G increase in cost since Season 6)

The New results:

{{item:3003}}  + {{item:3165}} 
1400 Mana (Same)
20% CDR (Same)
50 + ~30 AP + 80 AP = 160 AP ( 110-130 LESS AP)
300 HP (New)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In other words it loses 110 -130 AP to gain 300 HP, for an increase in the COST by 200-800G.

Keep in mind what else this means:

Less AP gain from {{item:3089}} 
No actual benefit from buying {{item:3027}} anymore
Diminished returns from building {{item:3110}} 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

No other item in the game has had a nerf that removes so much utility and actually INCREASED the price.

replies.body: My understanding is that this nerf only applies to Archangels, but not to Seraphs. This means that you get less AP from the item until you have it fully charged, where it then returns to its normal power. This is a nerf designed to make it not as strong of a rush item, which I'm 100% ok with. It's clearly meant to be the scaling item, but it's more than good enough as a rush item as well.

By the time you get to that late game scaling, which it is meant to exist for, it is no different from how it is now.

So... when is {{item:3087}} getting this kind of treatment or crit in general? Damage it gives on proc scales up to current level at 100% crit, is 1/3 of that with only 30% crit.???

or

When are we getting a {{item:3060}} that makes a minion nigh impregnable (like 95% dmg reduction) to physical damage? Of course it wouldn't be stackable on the same minion as banner though. But seriously, mages already have less reliable waveclear from safety than adc's at 2.5+ items in most cases.

That's still 16 minutes of the game with a hyper AP nerf to an item about 7-8 Champs use as their core AP potential while they charge it. That's what it takes MINIMUM to charge it, and by then, it might as well be a perma nerf in most cases, because at 16 minutes, most of the game is decided.

Champs like these are going to all need buffs on their low level skill tiers to compensate for the loss:

{{champion:34}} R damage will be garbage.
{{champion:99}} Will not have a viable item to ensure combos are kill possible early game.
{{champion:267}} Will heavily lose Heal potential as well as % Heal scaling on Ebb and Flow.
{{champion:13}} Will not have enough Mana scaling to actually ever get into a game.
{{champion:37}} Is going to hit significant heals much later, Drastically nerfing her already extremely weak early game, as well as her damage scaling.


There are others, but these 5 really have no other options for high scaling/efficiency play.

umm that make it even MORE of a "rush item" because you not NEED to get it to 750 mana for it to be useful?

No. You get Tear for the mana that eventually scales into a ton of AP when you turn it into Seraphs. That's why old Archangels champs would just get tear and then sit on it until it was mostly stacked and then upgrade. But now, Archangels gives enough AP that there's no reason to not rush the whole thing first item, and this causes it to push out items like GLP and Ludens that are supposed to be the quicker, lower scaling options. Before the changes, almost no one rushed Archangels because doing so left you without CDR for far too long, but that's no longer a concern. Something needs to give, and Riot is choosing its strength as a rush item. Seems like a decent place to target given everything the item does.

As someone who uses it in most of my games, I find the nerf to be justified.  The raw mana alone on it is just insane when talking base stats.  At full build, it gives me about 2.4k mana by itself.  The second highest mana item excluding Muramana is only 500 mana.  I will continue using Archangel's staff on Taric until they nerf the mana, in which case I will switch back to Manamune.
Mana doesn't win games. Damage/Heals does. Mana doesn't mean crap if you lose large sums of damage, especially with the new Manaflow and Presence of Mind.

I think you need to go look up Taric's kit.  Mana is essentially a second health bar for him.  His heal costs 100 mana and has a ~1 second cooldown.  Take your favorite champ and imagine spamming their ult every second.  Now think of the mana it would take to do so.

This actually upsets me, because Cassiopeia and many other mages spends about the first 15 or so minutes grinding the bonus mana for that item so that they can get that one power spike, and then they are back at just one item. And that isn't counting Archangel's not being upgraded to Seraph's Embrace. It is already so expensive to build, and there are enough Health+AP items already to build, like the Hextech Firebelt (or whatever it is), Rod of Ages, Liandry's Torment, and Rylai's Crystal Scepter...I need my mana + AP! And Seraph's Shield was nerfed too! Only 2 seconds? :( {{sticker:cass-cry}}

What aggravates me is.... there are MANY games where having high HP is a BAD thing. {{item:3036}} and Cut Down just shred high HP champs. So do champs with % Max HP damage. This is indirectly going to buff those % damage champs, because they can shred even faster, simply because one of the options to mitigate % damage or Max HP comparison damage is going to be unfeasible to build. 

What's worse is, the other non HP AP items all have utility and damage issues which make them fall behind in CDR scaling vs AD champs.

If you rush {{item:3102}} or {{item:3157}} for a specific purpose, your clear gets hurt, your damage takes a HUGE hit, and they don't really do anything but put a band-aid on the skills they're meant to be used vs ({{champion:238}} can kill you even if you Zhonya his Ult, so it doesn't solve the problem) They put you behind 10% CDR vs most AD champs, because it's inexpensive for AD's to rush 20% CDR in the forms of {{item:3133}} {{item:3057}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3101}} {{item:3147}} , which have many combinations which give the CDR and more damage - earlier, cheaper.

So.... most mages all are going {{item:3151}} (HP), {{item:3152}} (HP), {{item:3165}} (HP), {{item:3027}} (HP), {{item:3116}}  (HP) as their core items. That means..... Lord Dominik's destroys them as well as tanks.
It just feels like Rito gives AD champs every counter and damage, and continually has AP champs bend over and take it.

Doesn't even TOUCH the loss of AP. It's losing 110 AP overall, in exchange for 2 AP from Manaflow band, and 20% CDR, for an INCREASE of 500 gold in cost. 80 AP = It won't be bought at ALL. The whole purpose of the Mana Charging on it was to balance its AP scaling. Now it's the worst gold efficient item for a mage in the GAME.
cause lcs
ADCs doing well? Better nerf mages!

Ludens is such hot garbage now. "Lets give an early/mid game burst item absolutely no AP, while forcing to build lost chapter(so you can feel like shit when you upgrade to Ludens since you wont have any mana sustain at all)". Its just terrible itemizations in general

They removed items that were too versatile, but failed to realize that people were just going to gravitate towards whatever else was the next most well rounded buy.
Generally, if you have an item with lots of AP, CDR, and mana, most mages are going to default to it as the best bang for their buck. That's what the old Morello was.

Archangels gives you everything you want: Highest single AP item after rabadons, but the added benefit of 20% CDR, tons of mana and mana sustain, and a defensive shield. 

It's just better than Ludens in every way. Ludens has lost it's identity after losing movement speed. Nobody ever really thinks this is superior for poking. Arch will give you more AP to offset the lack of burst from luden's passive. More mana. More AP as the game goes on and you get more mana items. More mana sustain for poking. 

I also think they are making a huge mistake, nerfing the wrong aspect of archangel. They should reduce or remove the CDR, making Ludens the superior poke choice, and leaving Arch for what it always was: The late game scaling AP/mana option.

Nobody wants a low AP mana sustain item with CDR. That's too much like a support item we already have. 

Now, the main reason people never used Arch before was the lack of CDR. If you just wanted high AP, you had other options. And you didn't need it for mana sustain with other options that also gave AP. But, things are different now. If you made it 10% people would probably still use it, but there would be a more clear choice available. But if you made it 0% CDR, its use would be more limited but still probably a viable option for people who want both high AP and mana sustain but are not necessarily looking to spam abilities as fast as possible.
